{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.17754v1", "title": "Spall strength of symmetric tilt grain boundaries in 6H silicon carbide", "summary": "Characterizing microstructural effects on the dynamical response of materials
is challenging due to the extreme conditions and the short timescales involved.
For example, little is known about how grain boundary characteristics affect
spall strength. This study explores 6H-SiC bicrystals under shock waves via
large-scale molecular dynamics simulations. We focused on symmetric tilt grain
boundaries with a wide range of misorientations and found that spall strength
and dynamical fracture surface energy are strongly affected by the grain
boundary microstructure, especially the excess free volume. Grain boundary
energy also plays a considerable role. As expected, low-angle grain boundaries
tend to have higher spallation strengths. We also extracted cohesive models for
the dynamical strength of bulk systems and grain boundaries that can be used in
continuum simulations.", "main_category": "cond-mat.mtrl-sci", "categories": "cond-mat.mtrl-sci", "published": "2025-04-24T17:16:44Z"}
